name: Green roof
description: Roofs that are covered with a lightweight layer with a shallow growing medium.

name: Green roof
description: Roofs that have deep that can support a wide variety of plantings.

name: Green roof
type: Intensive green roof with retention layer
description: Roofs that have deep substrates that can support a wide variety of plantings and incorporate an extra retention layer.

name: Infiltration systems
description: Linear excavations filled with gravel or stone that create temporary subsurface storage of stormwater runoff.

name: Infiltration systems
description: Large shallow systems that are typically constructed using permeable aggregate or geocellular units that act as extensive soakaway systems.

name: Infiltration systems
description: Flat-bottomed shallow landscape depressions that store runoff before infiltration into the subsurface soils.

name: Filter strips
description: Area uniformly graded and gently sloping strips of grass or other dense vegetation that are designed to treat runoff from adjacent impermeable areas.

name: Swales
description: Conveyance and attenuation swales act similar to a pipeline in that they collect and carry surface water to the next stage in the SuDS management train.

name: Swales
description: Wet swales are specifically designed to provide wet or boggy conditions at their base.

name: Bioretention systems
description: Rain gardens are small bioretention systems that serve part of a single property.

name: Bioretention systems
description: Raised planters are boxed systems constructed above the surrounding ground surface with a planted soil mix and an underdrain to collect the filtered water.

name: Bioretention systems
description: A bioretention tree pit is a street tree pit with enhanced performance achieved through extra surface planting and soil amendments.

name: Bioretention systems
description: A bioretention swale is a shallow and vegetated depression with sloped sides that is located within the base of a swale.

name: Bioretention systems
description: A bioretention system that has the outlet pipe designed so that there is a permanent water level within the drainage layer to create an anaerobic environment at the bottom of the system.

name: Trees
description: Trees detain water in their canopies and enhance infiltration in their pits.

name: Pervious pavements
description: A type of permeable paving that consists of modular units that are laid on a permeable base and sub-base.

name: Pervious pavements
description: A type of ground protection that uses plastic or concrete grids infilled with grass or gravel to create a load-bearing grass reinforced surface.

name: Detention basins
description: Detention basins are landscaped depressions that are normally dry except during and immediately after storm events.

name: Ponds and wetlands
description: Ponds are features with a permanent pool of water that provide both attenuation and treatment of surface water runoff.

name: Ponds and wetlands
description: It is the improvement or adaptation of an existing pond to function as a Sustainable Urban Drainage System (SUDS).
